definitions: person who controls and profits from the activities of prostitutes
examples: The police arrested several pimps during the raid
He was sentenced to prison for working as a pimp

definitions: sleeveless apron-like garment worn over clothes for protection
examples: The little girl wore a blue pinafore over her white dress
School uniforms often include a pinafore for younger students

definitions: coin-operated game with metal ball bouncing off obstacles on tilted surface
examples: He spent hours playing pinball at the arcade
The vintage pinball machine still works perfectly after forty years

definitions: tool or claw with two parts that grip by closing together
examples: The crab's pincers can deliver a painful squeeze
He used pincers to extract the splinter from his finger

definitions: act of gripping something tightly between finger and thumb
very small amount of something typically spice or seasoning
examples: She gave him a playful pinch on the arm
The pinch left a red mark on his skin
Add just a pinch of salt to the recipe
A pinch of cinnamon enhances the flavor beautifully

definitions: small padded cushion used for holding pins and needles while sewing
examples: Her grandmother's pincushion was shaped like a tomato
She kept the pincushion next to her sewing machine

definitions: large tropical fruit with sweet yellow flesh and spiky exterior
examples: Fresh pineapple chunks make a refreshing summer snack
The pineapple plantation stretched for miles across the island

definitions: short high-pitched ringing sound made by metal or glass
electronic signal sent to test network connection or device response
examples: The ping of the elevator announced its arrival
We heard a metallic ping from the engine compartment
The technician will ping the server to check connectivity
My ping time to the game server is very low

definitions: flat or rounded top part of a pin
informal insulting term for person considered very stupid
examples: The pinhead was too large to fit through the fabric
These decorative pins have colorful pinheads
Don't be such a pinhead about this simple problem
He called his brother a pinhead during their argument

definitions: extremely small hole typically made by or for a pin
examples: Light streamed through a pinhole in the curtain
The pinhole camera uses this tiny opening instead of a lens

definitions: state of yearning or suffering with longing especially for someone absent
examples: Her pining for her lost love consumed her thoughts
The dog's pining for its owner was heartbreaking to witness

definitions: outer part of bird's wing including flight feathers
small gear wheel that engages with larger gear in mechanism
examples: The hawk spread its pinions and soared into the sky
One pinion was damaged preventing the bird from flying properly
The clock's pinion meshes perfectly with the main gear
A broken pinion caused the mechanical failure

definitions: informal term for the smallest finger on the human hand
examples: She wore a delicate ring on her pinkie finger
He broke his pinkie playing basketball last week

definitions: informal term for the smallest finger on the human hand
examples: They made a pinky promise to keep the secret
She painted her pinky nail a different color

definitions: highest or most successful point of something
pointed stone ornament on top of buttress or parapet in architecture
examples: Winning the championship was the pinnacle of her career
He reached the pinnacle of success in his fifties
Gothic cathedrals feature ornate pinnacles on their towers
The pinnacle was carved from a single block of limestone

definitions: act of attaching or securing something using pins
act of holding opponent down in wrestling or combat
examples: She spent the afternoon pinning fabric for the dress
Pinning the notices to the bulletin board took several minutes
The wrestler succeeded in pinning his opponent for three seconds
Pinning techniques are essential in judo competitions

definitions: extremely small or precise point or area
examples: The laser created a pinpoint of light on the wall
Doctors found a pinpoint hemorrhage during the examination

definitions: unit of liquid capacity equal to one-eighth of a gallon
examples: She ordered a pint of beer at the pub
The recipe calls for one pint of heavy cream

definitions: horse with irregular patches of white and another color
examples: The cowboy rode a beautiful pinto across the prairie
Her pinto mare had distinctive brown and white markings

definitions: toy consisting of colored vanes that spin when blown or moved through air
examples: Children ran through the garden holding colorful pinwheels
The pinwheel spun rapidly in the summer breeze

definitions: person among the first to settle in new territory
person who develops or is first to use new methods or ideas
examples: The pioneers traveled west in covered wagons seeking new land
These brave pioneers endured incredible hardships settling the frontier
Marie Curie was a pioneer in the field of radioactivity
The company was a pioneer in developing electric vehicles

definitions: small hard seed found in fruit such as apples or oranges
dot or spot on dice domino or playing card
examples: She carefully removed every pip from the orange segments
Apple pips contain small amounts of cyanide compounds
The dice showed five pips on one side
Count the pips to determine your domino score

definitions: person who plays the pipes especially bagpipes or flute
examples: The Scottish piper led the parade in full Highland dress
We hired a piper to play at the wedding ceremony

definitions: complex arrangement or system of pipes in building or machinery
examples: The plumber inspected all the pipework in the basement
Corrosion in the pipework caused several leaks

definitions: system of pipes used for conveying water gas or other materials
thin cord covered with fabric used as decorative edging
examples: The building's piping needs to be replaced due to age
Copper piping is commonly used for water supply lines
The cushion featured elegant piping around the edges
She added contrasting piping to the jacket seams

definitions: feeling of irritation or resentment from wounded pride or slight
examples: His pique was evident when he wasn't invited to the meeting
She left in a fit of pique after the argument

definitions: practice of attacking and robbing ships at sea
unauthorized copying or use of copyrighted material
examples: Piracy was common in Caribbean waters during the 1700s
The navy increased patrols to combat piracy
Software piracy costs companies billions in lost revenue
Online piracy of movies has become a major concern

definitions: small South American freshwater fish with sharp teeth and aggressive feeding behavior
examples: The piranha can strip flesh from bone in minutes
Despite their reputation piranhas rarely attack humans

definitions: edible green nut from Asian tree often used in cooking and snacks
examples: She added chopped pistachios to the baklava recipe
The ice cream was flavored with real pistachio nuts

definitions: marked ski run or trail on mountain for skiing
examples: The black piste was too difficult for beginner skiers
Fresh snow covered all the pistes at the resort

definitions: small firearm designed to be held and fired with one hand
examples: The officer drew his service pistol from its holster
She practiced target shooting with a competition pistol

definitions: sliding disk or cylinder that moves within tube to compress gases in engine
examples: The mechanic replaced a damaged piston in the engine
Each piston moves up and down thousands of times per minute

definitions: round flat bread that can be split to form pocket for filling
examples: She stuffed the pita with falafel and vegetables
Fresh pita bread is soft and perfect for dipping

definitions: long-handled fork with prongs used for lifting and pitching hay
examples: The farmer used a pitchfork to move hay into the barn
An old pitchfork leaned against the stable wall

definitions: act of throwing baseball from mound to batter
forward and backward rocking motion of ship in rough seas
examples: His pitching improved dramatically after coaching sessions
The team needs better pitching to win more games
The ship's pitching made several passengers seasick
Severe pitching and rolling threatened the cargo

definitions: hidden or unexpected danger difficulty or mistake that could cause problems
examples: Avoiding common pitfalls can save time and money on projects
The contract contained several legal pitfalls

definitions: soft spongy tissue in stems and branches of plants
essential or most important part of something
examples: Orange pith contains beneficial nutrients despite its bitter taste
The pith must be removed from the sugarcane
She captured the pith of his argument in one sentence
The pith of the matter is quite simple

definitions: formation of small hollows or indentations on a surface
examples: Corrosion caused severe pitting on the metal surface
The doctor noted pitting in the patient's fingernails

definitions: small gland at brain base that produces hormones regulating growth and development
examples: The pituitary gland controls many other hormone-producing glands
A tumor on her pituitary affected her growth hormones

definitions: feeling of sympathy and sorrow for someone's misfortune or suffering
examples: She felt deep pity for the homeless man on the street
It's a pity that such talent goes unrecognized

definitions: central point on which something turns or balances
movement where player keeps one foot stationary while moving the other
examples: The gate swings smoothly on its metal pivot
This decision marks a major pivot in company strategy
She executed a perfect pivot before passing the ball
The center's pivot move created space for the shot

definitions: informal plural term for pictures or photographs
examples: She posted her vacation pix on social media
Send me the pix from last night's party

definitions: smallest unit of digital image that can be displayed or controlled
examples: The screen resolution is 1920 by 1080 pixels
Each pixel contains color information for the display

definitions: small supernatural being or fairy in folklore typically portrayed as mischievous
examples: The children's book featured a friendly pixie who helped lost travelers
She styled her hair in a short pixie cut

definitions: restaurant that specializes in making and selling pizzas
examples: The neighborhood pizzeria makes authentic Italian-style pizza
We ordered takeout from our favorite pizzeria

definitions: large card or sign carried or displayed to convey message publicly
examples: Protesters carried placards demanding better working conditions
The placard on the door listed the store hours

definitions: harmless substance given as medicine but containing no active medical ingredient
examples: Half the patients received the drug while others got a placebo
The placebo effect can produce real improvements in symptoms

definitions: symbol or text temporarily used until final content is available
examples: The designer used Lorem Ipsum as placeholder text
This image is just a placeholder until we get the final photo

definitions: football player who specializes in kicking field goals and extra points
examples: The team's placekicker scored the winning field goal
A good placekicker can make kicks from fifty yards away

definitions: organ that develops in uterus during pregnancy to nourish the fetus
examples: The placenta provides oxygen and nutrients to the developing baby
After delivery the placenta is naturally expelled from the body
